definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: The printed word always fascinated horace .
sentences.chinese: 書上的鉛字總使小霍勒斯着迷。

sentences.english: All the lines of type should be ranged.
sentences.chinese: 每行鉛字都應在終端排齊。

sentences.english: The book was in large print.
sentences.chinese: 這本書是用大號鉛字印的。

sentences.english: He made a mark on the book with a marker.
sentences.chinese: 他用鉛字筆在書上作記號。

sentences.english: The book is printed in large type.
sentences.chinese: 這本書用大號鉛字印刷。

sentences.english: The types in the grids of the tray are also arranged regularly.
sentences.chinese: 拖盤裏每個小格子裏的鉛字排序也是有規律的。

sentences.english: I could feel the type on the paper with my fingers.
sentences.chinese: 我用手指可以觸摸到文件上的鉛字。

sentences.english: In printing, a heavier version of a particular typeface.
sentences.chinese: 印刷技術中指專用鉛字面的一種加粗形式。

sentences.english: The rearrangement type is wanted to this book.

definition: paper matrix in which type is set
rough sketch (of a painting)/(of an official) to approve a document by signing it
